http://httpd.apache.org/docs/: If you are security minded, a hardware firewall is what you need.
All a firewall will do is block ports that you choose
Why can't anyone on the internet see it?  What's your ip address?
80/tcp    filtered http [your IP]       What does this mean?
Means that your ISP is more than likely filtering [blocking]  incomming connection attempts to it's users.
That's why someone suggested using a non-standard port.
So you could tell  apache to listen on port 443, and tell users to access your server via port 443.  e.g.  http://151.196.21.23:443
edit  /etc/apache/httpd.conf   and then restart the server
sudo /etc/init.d/apache restart  or something like that.
